metadata.Title: CVE-2023-39192 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Netfilter subsystem in the Linux kernel. The xt_u32 module did not validate the fields in the xt_u32 structure. This flaw allows a local privileged attacker to trigger an out-of-bounds read by setting the size fields with a value beyond the array boundaries, leading to a crash or information disclosure. Sunjoo Park discovered that the netfilter subsystem in the Linux kernel did not properly validate u32 packets content, leading to an out-of-bounds read vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-7-generic - 6.5.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-7-generic - 6.5.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-7-generic-64k - 6.5.0-7.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-aws - 6.5.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1006-azure - 6.5.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1006-gcp - 6.5.0-1006.6
No subscription required
